etymologies: mid 16th century: perhaps related to champion. The name was originally used for the rose campion, whose name in Latin (Lychnis coronaria) and Greek (lukhnis stephanōmatikē) means ‘campion fit for a crown’, and which was said in classical times to have been used for victors' garlands

definitions: a plant of the pink family, typically having pink or white flowers with notched petals, found in both Eurasia and North America.

notes.text: Genera Silene and Lychnis, family Caryophyllaceae
